Title: A Comparative Analysis on Sarcasm Detection
Abstract: sarcasm detection is a difficult challenge in natural language processing as it needs to understand the speaker intention which can be opposite to the actual meaning of the words used recent advancements in sarcasm detection have been made using machine learning techniques such as various text embedding techniques with context aware pre trained deep learning architectures. this research work is a comparative analysis of various machine learning models on two different publicly available datasets  isarcasm and news headlines dataset. upon using the same parameters the ensemble machine learning models have better performed on varied smaller yet imbalanced isarcasm dataset whereas complex deep learning models have given better results on structured larger and balanced news headlines dataset.
